RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 6, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 6, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FU MAN SUE took over toward the three eighths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the quarter, rounded the turn off the rail and was steadily handled to widen. GRAND FIBER raced briefly clear and angled to the inside, chased the winner nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and settled for second. ROLL DEM BONES chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail, was eased out entering the stretch and finished evenly. GRUMPELSTILTSKIN became a bit anxious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened the final sixteenth. BUCKED TOOTH chased the pace inside then flattened at the rail on the turn. SHACKLED gave chase through the backstretch but flattened in the four path of the turn. SCOTTY SILVER gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path. UNNAMED SOLDIER saved ground.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRYDA quickly took over drew off to a long early lead, raced near the rail on the turn and was kept sharp through the stretch. PLAYING FOR TWO gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and proved no match. MAKINLIMMARGARITAS chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. CARMELIZED chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SMOKIN LADY gave chase, came through the turn in the three path and finished evenly to improve her position. SHOWTHEMONEYHONEY chased, raced two deep on the turn then weakened. GOLDEN SALLY gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little more. POLISH THE DIAMOND chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn, left the turn outside and weakened. XPOSED SECRET gave chase, raced in the three path of the turn and weakened. LOCKDOWN VANNA broke awkwardly and was jostled at the break.

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Stryda
ENTRY.COMMENT: quickly in front,long lead,rail turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 16200. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 6, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less N ot Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEVOTED KITTEN settled in the three path then bid leaving the half mile pole, drew to even terms two deep midway on the far turn, dug in determinedly to take over in late yards and raced clear at the wire. LIQUID LOUIE stalked from the three path, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead two deep passing the five sixteenths, was met midway on the far turn and dueled at even terms most of the stretch before relenting late yards. BOSSY CAT settled off the rail, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn in the three path, cleared third inside the sixteenth pole and finished well. TAPPIN FOR GLORY saved ground, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. JAMMIN STILL rated a slim lead off the rail, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met past the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened stride in the lane. TOP HAT TREASON raced with the pace through the first turn then stalked from the seven sixteenths pole, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths but weakened at the rail on the far turn. LUFTY'S KISSES dropped back and saved early ground then rounded the far turn about the four path. ASK NEAL raced outside on the first two turns then saved ground on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Tappin for Glory
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

ENTRY.NAME: Bossy Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,3p far turn,clear 3rd inside 1/16,finished well

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LA MADDALENA drew clear toward the half mile pole and angled in to set a pressured pace, dug in to the challenge of JUBASLILBALLERINA while two deep on the turn and raced determinedly to keep that one at bay through the lane. The latter came in and made contact with Odina in the vicinity of the half mile pole then gave chase inside, challenged while in tight at the rail midway on the turn and dug in gamely before relenting late yards. JUMPIN JACK BRASS steadied on the chute then gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path, angled to the five path leaving the turn, dueled for third mid-stretch and finished well while gaining on the top two. VAN HOOK angled in early and gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. GREY FLAMINGO gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. AWESOME MOON raced in tight early, gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened stride. ODINA was bumped while in tight in the vicinity of the half mile pole, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the stretch. APPEALING ROAD was crowded early, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn in the three and four paths. ELLIES AT WINDSOR was through early. S S FRONTIER ANGEL gave chase and rounded the turn in the five and six paths. The Stewards reviewed two claims of foul. First claim was against the rider of Jubasliballerina lodged by the rider of Odina for alleged interference in the vicinity of the half mile pole. Second claim was against the rider of La Maddalena for alleged interference on the turn, lodged by the rider of Jubaslilballerina. Both claims were rejected.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAYS CASTLE rounded the first turn in the three path, rallied to the front approaching the five sixteenths pole and edged clear midway on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling and widened the final sixteenth. TENNIS TAP was bumped outward and into EX RATED leaving the gate then saved ground, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced five wide on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second. The latter was bumped at the break and saved ground well back from early contention, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. HOW IS SHE settled off the rail and rounded the far turn near the rail, angled out toward the head of the lane and passed some rivals outside. IHEARTRAINACOMN veered outward and made contact with Tennis Tap leaving the gate, raced with the pace two deep and dueled leaving the half mile pole, drew to even terms at the three eighths pole but dropped back midway on the far turn and flattened in later yards. AIM'S JUBILEE stalked inside, lacked room into the far turn, eased to the three path through the turn then flattened later yards. DIXIE YODELER rated a slim lead inside, was met and dueled Iheartrainacomn from the half mile pole, was caught at the five sixteenths pole but continued close at the rail through the far turn before weakening. SARAH'S WARRIOR settled close off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the turn four wide then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Aim's Jubilee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,lacked room into turn,3p turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled close off rail,chased 3/8,4wd far turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISSIONARY was reluctant to load but contested the pace from the start and dueled determinedly to clear CUPID'S SONG in late yards, while the latter, contested the pace from the start and factored to mid-stretch, but reluctantly ceded later yards. ROCKIN CHAIR chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly through the lane. JUBAY gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and finished evenly. ASTRAYAL exchanged contact with He's Clever leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. WINDSOR'S STAR chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn then flattened. HE'S CLEVER became a bit anxious in the gate then bobbled and exchanged contact with Astrayal at the start, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. GETTIN SPICY gave chase, was never a factor and raced off the rail on the turn. CURB THAT TIGER saved ground. SHADE TREE CORNER gave chase then saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Missionary
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load,contested pace,dueled clear late yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WITH SECRET ENERGY settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily progressed in the five path of the far turn, dueled for the lead past the eighth pole, raced clear mid-stretch and widened the final sixteenth. PERSONABLE rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced in the five path of the far turn and dug in through the stretch to take second later yards. ROCKET'S CASTLE settled in the three and four paths of the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the six path of the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane and took the nod for third under the wire. JAXJAXXORJACKS settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, steadied past the sixteenth pole and finished evenly. SARGENT KOBE raced with the pace inside then dueled from the three eighths pole, contested the advantage nearest the rail on the far turn, but was met inside the eighth pole and weakened. REATA'S CASTLE raced with the pace two deep, dueled from the three eighths pole, dropped back at the five sixteenths and weakened in the lane. MODERN DAY ROMANCE saved ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but faded into the far turn and was eased to the four path through the turn. THEWITCHISGONE settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then weakened. JUBA BOUND rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase into the backstretch, raced in the three path on the far turn and weakened in the lane. WELL EQUIPPED rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Well Equipped
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,dueled from 3/8,rail far turn,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Thewitchisgone
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 3p,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: With Secret Energy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,5p far turn,up past 1/8,widened driving

ENTRY.NAME: Jaxjaxxorjacks
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,steadied past 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Con sidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEBIT CARD tapered in approaching the first turn then stalked three wide into the turn, took the nod past the half mile pole, was urged clear at the five sixteenths, drew off at the rail through the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. RUN TO DAYLIGHT saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn then dueled for second mid-stretch. NOID set the early pace inside then moved to the rail into the first turn, was met past the half mile pole and gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the far turn at the rail, ceded second mid-stretch but held on for third. ALLEN CAN DO IT steadied in tight into the first turn then rated close in the two and three paths, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. HOT FUDGE SONDE settled off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths then flattened in the lane. SPUNMAN raced off the pace two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, flattened in the three path of the far turn then eased outward toward the head of the lane. HUMPTY GRUMPTY raced in tight between horses nearing the first turn then rated close through the turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but faded on the far turn. HAPPY CHARLIE saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Debit Card for alleged interference into the first turn, lodged by the rider of Allen Can Do It, then disqualified Noid for the alleged infraction.

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Humpty Grumpty
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight early,rated close,chased 3/8,faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight 5/8,2& 3p,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLATINUM FROLIC rated close through the front stretch then took over and set the pace from the five eighths pole, dueled Helluva Lady from the three eighths pole, cleared that one toward the quarter, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. SWEET ANNABELLA rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, eased out leaving the turn and dug in through the lane to take second under the wire. AWESOME INCENTIVE settled back off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but was nipped from second under the wire. SKYFLY raced in the five path the first turn and entered the backstretch outside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened the final sixteenth. HELLUVA LADY tapered in and took the lead approaching the three quarter pole then stalked from the five eighths, dueled Platinum Frolic leaving the three eighths pole but dropped back toward the quarter and weakened into the stretch. SARAH BELLUM steadied at the start and raced off the rail on the first turn, was eased to the outside and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn in the six path and showed little in the lane. PARTY MONSTER saved ground. GOSSIPING raced off the rail on the first turn, showed no response leaving the turn and gave way past the three eighths pole. VIVE EL MOMENTO saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. ESPERANNNA closed toward contention through the front stretch and stalked from the three path, gave chase into the backstretch then weakened in the three path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Annabella
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,chased 7/16,3p far turn,dug in lane,up 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah Bellum
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start,eased out 1/2,chased,6p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Incentive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,dug in lane,nipped 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Esperannna
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J
ENTRY.COMMENT: up to contend near 3/4,stalked 3p,chased 1/2,weakened far turn
